title: fizzbuzz challenge
description: Write a program that prints numbers from 1 to 100. For multiples of 3, print 'Fizz', and for multiples of 5, print 'Buzz'. For numbers that are multiples of both, print 'FizzBuzz'.
instructions: Implement logic to check divisors and print appropriate strings based on conditions.

title: reverse string
description: Write a function that reverses a given string.
instructions: Given a string, return the reversed version of it without using built-in reverse methods.

title: sum of array
description: Write a program that takes an array of integers and returns the sum of all the elements.
instructions: You are provided an array of integers. Return the sum of its elements.

title: find maximum number
description: Write a program to find the maximum number in a given array of integers.
instructions: You are provided an array of integers. Return the maximum number in the array.

title: string manipulation challenge
description: Split a given string based on a delimiter and return an array.
instructions:
### Instructions
- Implement a function that takes two arguments:
  - A string `inputString`
  - A string `delimiter`
- Split the `inputString` using the `delimiter` and return the resulting array.

### Example
```javascript
splitString("a,b,c", ","); // ["a", "b", "c"]
```

title: palindrome checker
description: Write a function that checks if a given string is a palindrome.
instructions: Given a string, return true if it is a palindrome (ignoring case and non-alphanumeric characters), and false otherwise.

testCases.input: "A man, a plan, a canal, Panama"

title: merge sorted arrays
description: Write a program to merge two sorted arrays into one sorted array.
instructions: Given two arrays of integers sorted in ascending order, return a single merged array that is also sorted in ascending order.

title: binary tree depth
description: Write a program to calculate the maximum depth of a binary tree.
instructions: Given a binary tree, return the maximum depth of the tree. The depth of a binary tree is the number of nodes along the longest path from the root to a leaf.

title: knapsack problem
description: Solve the 0/1 knapsack problem using dynamic programming.
instructions: Given weights and values of n items, put these items in a knapsack of capacity W to get the maximum total value in the knapsack.

title: find first missing positive
description: Write a program to find the smallest missing positive integer in an unsorted array.
instructions: Given an unsorted array, find the smallest missing positive integer in O(n) time and using constant space.

title: Number Sorting Challenge
description: Sort an array of numbers in ascending order.
instructions:
### Instructions
- Implement a function that takes an array of numbers as input.
- Sort the numbers in ascending order and return the sorted array.

### Example
```javascript
sortNumbers([3, 1, 2]); // [1, 2, 3]```
